intro: Hymenocardia punctata, commonly known as the spotted tamarind, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, woody pods that contain several seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and traditional medicine.
